DisplayedItem.name: DI_362538
DisplayedItem.title: Measurement should include optic nerve attached to globe and any additionally submitted optic nerve segments

Question.title: Tumor Site (macroscopic examination / transillumination) (Notes D, E)

Question.title: Tumor Site after Sectioning (Notes E, F, G)

Question.title: Tumor Size after Sectioning (Notes E, F, G)

Question.name: Q_356247
Question.title: Basal Diameter at Cut Edge of Tumor

Question.name: Q_356265
Question.title: Thickness at Cut Edge of Tumor

Question.name: Q_379820
Question.title: Percentage of Vitreous Cavity Occupied by Tumor

Question.name: Q_356283
Question.title: Distance from Anterior Edge of Tumor to Limbus at Cut Edge

Question.name: Q_356274
Question.title: Distance from Posterior Margin of Tumor Base to Edge of Optic Disc

ListItem.name: LI_42227
ListItem.title: G1 (tumor with areas of retinocytoma [fleurettes or neuronal differentiation accounting for more than half of tumor])

ListItem.name: LI_52406
ListItem.title: G2 (tumor with many rosettes [Flexner–Wintersteiner or Homer Wright rosettes accounting for more than half of tumor])

ListItem.name: LI_51487
ListItem.title: G3 (tumor with occasional rosettes [Flexner–Wintersteiner or Homer Wright rosettes accounting for less than half of tumor])

ListItem.name: LI_42519
ListItem.title: G4 (tumor with poorly differentiated cells without rosettes and/or with extensive areas [more than half of tumor] of anaplasia)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_33246
DisplayedItem.title: Grade based on the highest level of anaplasia in the tumor, with at least 30% of the tumor being able to be graded.

Question.name: Q_51470
Question.title: Histopathologic Features Suggesting MYCN Amplification (Note I)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_53634
DisplayedItem.title: Unilateral retinoblastoma with more rounded, undifferentiated cells, with prominent nucleoli, and absence of nuclear molding, differentiated rosettes, and extensive calcification. The histology of MYCN retinoblastoma is more similar to neuroblastoma than it is to RB1−/− retinoblastoma.

Question.name: Q_355491
Question.title: Other Ocular Structures Involved by Tumor (Note J)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_355491_1
Property.val: Other Ocular Structures Involved by Tumor

ListItem.name: LI_6164
ListItem.title: Choroid, minimal (solid tumor nest less than 3 mm in maximum diameter [width or thickness])

ListItem.name: LI_6165
ListItem.title: Choroid, massive (solid tumor nest 3 mm or more in maximum diameter [width or thickness])

ListItem.name: LI_355493
ListItem.title: Sclera (direct invasion into outer half without episcleral invasion)

ListItem.name: LI_355494
ListItem.title: Sclera (direct invasion into outer half with episcleral invasion)

ListItem.name: LI_6199
ListItem.title: Posterior to lamina cribrosa but not to end of nerve

ListItem.name: LI_6200
ListItem.title: To cut end of optic nerve

ListItem.name: LI_6236
ListItem.title: Tumor present at surgical margin of optic nerve

ListItem.name: LI_39531
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_355501
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_355502
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_46773
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Section.name: S_6209
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note K)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_57493
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_57493_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_355509
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_51656
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of intraocular tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_356678
DisplayedItem.title: # CAP Author's Note: Tumors with focal choroidal invasion ONLY (not meeting criteria for pT3a) without concomitant optic nerve invasion and tumors with pre-or intralaminar involvement of the optic nerve head ONLY without concomitant choroidal invasion are included in pT1 category.

ListItem.name: LI_41646
ListItem.title: pT1: Intraocular tumor(s) without any local invasion, focal choroidal invasion, or pre- or intralaminar involvement of the optic nerve head#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39266
DisplayedItem.title: pT2: Intraocular tumor(s) with local invasion

ListItem.name: LI_43103
ListItem.title: pT2a: Concomitant focal choroidal invasion and pre- or intralaminar involvement of the optic nerve head

ListItem.name: LI_42705
ListItem.title: pT2b: Tumor invasion of stroma of iris and / or trabecular meshwork and / or Schlemm’s canal

DisplayedItem.name: DI_46242
DisplayedItem.title: pT3: Intraocular tumor(s) with significant local invasion

ListItem.name: LI_58686
ListItem.title: pT3a: Massive choroidal invasion (greater than 3 mm in largest diameter, or multiple foci of focal choroidal involvement totaling greater than 3 mm, or any full-thickness choroidal involvement)

ListItem.name: LI_59436
ListItem.title: pT3b: Retrolaminar invasion of the optic nerve head, not involving the transected end of the optic nerve

ListItem.name: LI_54587
ListItem.title: pT3c: Any partial-thickness involvement of the sclera within the inner two thirds

ListItem.name: LI_46664
ListItem.title: pT3d: Full-thickness invasion into the outer third of the sclera and / or invasion into or around emissary channels

ListItem.name: LI_44686
ListItem.title: pT4: Evidence of extraocular tumor: tumor at the transected end of the optic nerve, tumor in the meningeal spaces around the optic nerve, full-thickness invasion of the sclera with invasion of the episclera, adjacent adipose tissue, extraocular muscle, bone, conjunctiva, or eyelids

ListItem.name: LI_355510
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_355511
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_6225
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node involvement

ListItem.name: LI_57902
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_57902_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50289
DisplayedItem.title: pM1: Distant metastasis with histopathologic confirmation

ListItem.name: LI_59144
ListItem.title: pM1a: Histopathologic confirmation of tumor at any distant site (e.g., bone marrow, liver, or other)

ListItem.name: LI_39894
ListItem.title: pM1b: Histopathologic confirmation of tumor in the cerebrospinal fluid or CNS parenchyma

ListItem.name: LI_355525
ListItem.title: HX:Unknown or insufficient evidence of a constitutional RB1 gene mutation

ListItem.name: LI_355526
ListItem.title: H0: Normal RB1 alleles in blood tested with demonstrated high-sensitivity assays

ListItem.name: LI_355527
ListItem.title: H1: Bilateral retinoblastoma, any retinoblastoma with an intracranial primitive neuroectodermal tumor (ie, trilateral retinoblastoma), patient with family history of retinoblastoma, or molecular definition of a constitutional RB1 gene mutation

ListItem.name: LI_359634
ListItem.title: Mitotic rate (specify number of mitoses per mm2)
